entry.title: The Ritz, 1976 - ★★½
entry.content: 🎥 The Ritz, 1976 ⭐️ ★★½ The Ritz is chaotic, loud, and uneven. If it weren't for Rita Moreno’s gloriously over-the-top performance, it might not be watchable at all. The film has a few genuinely funny moments, but they’re too scattered to give it🔗 https://letterboxd.com/julienpierre/film/the-ritz/ #FilmReview

entry.title: Rebecca, 1940 - ★★★★★
entry.content: 🎥 Rebecca, 1940 ⭐️ ★★★★★ Rebecca is arguably Hitchcock's strongest early sound-era entry. From the first eerie shots of Manderley to the final blaze, this is unmistakably Hitchcock. The film bears his fingerprints in every frame, its meticulous cutting, haunting...🔗 https://letterboxd.com/julienpierre/film/rebecca/1/ #FilmReview
